abstract: Editorial maintains that in awarding the 2011 Nobel in economic sciences to Christopher Sims and Thomas Sargent, whose research examines the relationship between government policy and economic outcomes, the prize committee delivered a challenge to politicians who are driven more by ideology than by consideration of the real-world consequences of their actions.

headline.print_headline: A Prize and a Challenge: At a time when ideology too often wins out, an argument for analysis
